intro: Ixia geminata, commonly known as the double-axle lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Ixia geminata typically grows from a bulb and prefers well-drained, sandy soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
